JobDescription: We are looking for a Data Architect with 15+ years of experience in IT/Technology and at least 3+ years of experience in Azure/Databricks.

Continuously monitor and optimize Databricks workloads for performance and cost-effectiveness
Implement and maintain security measures, including access controls, encryption, and compliance standards, to protect sensitive data

Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in Databricks and related technologies to recommend and implement improvements
Good knowledge of SQL Queries & Stored Procedures
Strong programming skills in Pyspark, Python, writing complex queries in T-SQL
Experience in transferring data from RDBMS to Data bricks using ADF
Expertise in using Spark SQL with various data sources like JSON, Parquet, and XML
Experience in creating tables, partitioning, bucketing, loading, and aggregating data using Spark SQL/Python
Experience with the Insurance Domain

JobDescription: We are looking for a Kinaxis Solution Architect in the manufacturing domain, who can proficiently perform in Kinaxis implementation projects. Having any relevant supply chain certifications like CSCP and Rapid Response Solution Architect certification would be a plus. The rate will be competitive based on the Indian Market Rate.
JobDescPoints: Perform the role of solution architect for Kinaxis implementation projects. Connect with client stakeholders to understand requirements, perform fit-gap analysis, design and document solutions and handle configuration team to execute the solution.
Connect with client business stakeholders. Coordinate with development functions, business lines, product teams, and technology stakeholders to determine the technology's future state and roadmap.
Create designs that balance business efficiency, system performance, security, and compliance while ensuring architectural and security standards.
Skills: Minimum 10-15 years of experience in implementing Kinaxis and other related SCM software solutions in client environments.
Must have been a Solution Architect on at least two Kinaxis implementation projects.
Should have completed Rapid Response Author Level 2 certification.
Strong functional knowledge and experience in Rapid Response applications like Supply Planning, Capacity Planning (Constraints), DRP, MPS, Demand Planning, and Inventory Management.
Strong design and software setup skills are required, as well as a solid understanding of data models.
Must know about integrating Kinaxis with SAP, Oracle, and legacy systems.
Need to have implementation experience in establishing demand and supply planning modules.
Must be a strong collaborator, team player as well as individual contributor.
Should have strong communication skills with confidence in dealing with business stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to lead and handle the team to push the solution and drive progress.
Open to travel - short/long-term.

Role: Lead Internal Control over Financial Reporting (ICFR) Analyst
JobDescription: Need USC, GC, and EADs. Ideal candidates should have the equivalent of a Big Four manager experience (Deloitte, EY, KPMG, PwC). They must have the appropriate level of knowledge across both Accounting/Business Process control and ITGCs as they will be expected to assist in both areas depending on need.
Skills: Desired designation - Certified Public Accountant (CPA)
Desired designation - Certified Internal Auditor (CIA)
Desired designation - Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA).
Bachelor's degree in accounting, or related field, or the equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.
Major experience that is consistent with what SOX 407 defines as "expert": Advanced understanding of SOX, including GAAP concepts, financial statement planning, and internal accounting controls.
To deliver internal control guidance, assess control effectiveness, and suggest improvements to control-related procedures within NFCU business processes, IT systems, and applications.
Research and implement new practices to achieve credit union control alignment with Section 404 of the Sarbanes Oxley Act (SOX) like environment.
Connect with key business partners regarding processes, key financial controls, and financial statement risks to lower the risk of financial misstatement.
Work with various business units to reduce risk through control-centric process implementation and automation.

In charge of collecting data, drafting reports, documenting and evaluating Internal Control Over Financial Reporting (ICFR), and creating evidence of control operational and design effectiveness to facilitate auditable evidence delivery to internal and external auditors.
Handle complex/unusual tasks of significant impact that require extensive analysis.
